main event: A bright light or object was observed in the sky over Colorado Springs, Colorado on April 27, 1967 from around 2310 to 2330 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as similar to a bright star, with no distinguishing characteristics of its own.
The object hovered and then moved slowly in a southwesterly to northwesterly direction.
No photographs were taken of the object.
The object was initially thought to be a 'falling star', but the Air Force concluded it was a 'possible' unidentified object.
sighted object: bright light or object in the sky
